attributes.action: Boris Johnson must resign because he acted unlawfully in proroguing Parliament.
attributes.background: The Supreme Court has ruled that Boris Johnson acted unlawfully in proroguing Parliament. A Prime Minister who has abused his power in this way is unfit to hold that position.

rejection.details:
The resignation of the Prime Minister would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or Parliament, you could start a petition about that.
